messages.subject: Conference question
messages.msgSnippet: ... ====================== Second weekend in September, as close as I know.    When it s wholly announced I ll bring the lnk here.   But for now, there are
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 10/27/05 11:10:40 PM, salamanderstarr@... writes:


> -=-Have dates been set?  If not any idea when they will be...?  I'd love a
> good
> excuse to plan a week in Albuquerque.-=-
>
======================

Second weekend in September, as close as I know. When it's wholly
announced I'll bring the lnk here. But for now, there are photos of the intended
site and of things around there (with Holly and Marty in for scale <g>), and also
links to people's photos from the conference in St. Louis.

http://sandradodd.com/abq

ABQ is the airline code for Albuquerque, which is why I used abq. It's the
quickest-to-write abbreviation.

Sandra




[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Conference question
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 2/15/03 2:47:13 PM Eastern Standard Time, ... Yes, my DH had a great time.  He spent quite a bit of time with the boys while I spent more
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 2/15/03 2:47:13 PM Eastern Standard Time,
skreams@... writes:

> So, what I need to know is, did spouses
> who have no idea who you all are have a good time at the conference too?
>

Yes, my DH had a great time. He spent quite a bit of time with the boys
while I spent more time listening to speakers but he did get to talk with
other dads and watch the boys interact with other children that think like
they do. He wants to go again.
Pam G.


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

>who have no idea who you all are have a good time at the conference too?

Life is good.
~Mary

messages.subject: Conference question
messages.msgSnippet: I d really like to come to the conference this year, and I m hoping ya ll can give me some info that ll help get me there :0).  Jon s been out of work since
messages.messageBody:
I'd really like to come to the conference this year, and I'm hoping
ya'll can give me some info that'll help get me there :0). Jon's been
out of work since last April, so going would be a big splurge. He's
said it's up to me, and he'll go happily if I decide we're going (we
travel as a pack :0)) but I don't want to bring him and have him
miserable the whole weekend. So, what I need to know is, did spouses
who have no idea who you all are have a good time at the conference too?
He completely 'gets' unschooling and he's not shy - I think he'd have
fun. What say ye? ~Rue

"Pay no attention to the man behind the curtain."



[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
